title: 'Predictability has huge premium': EAM on India-Germany ties amid Trump tariff war
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar emphasized the importance of predictability in global politics amidst shifting relations with China and US tariffs. He highlighted the need for closer collaboration between India, the EU, and Germany due to global strategic and economic volatility. Wadephul stressed the Western nations' desire for peace in Ukraine, noting Russia's unwillingness to negotiate despite efforts.

title: Indore hospital rat infestation: Second newborn girl dies
content: In a tragic turn of events, a newborn girl, already weakened by congenital anomalies and abandoned by her parents, died in an Indore hospital after being bitten by rats.

title: 'Not just optics': EU diplomat says Xi-Putin-Kim meet a bid for 'new world order'
content: A Beijing parade featuring Xi Jinping alongside Putin and Kim Jong Un has sparked EU criticism, with concerns raised about a challenge to the Western-led global order. The event, marking the end of World War II, showcased China's military might and growing ambitions. Trump accused the leaders of conspiring against the US, while the Kremlin dismissed the claims.

title: Rule forever? What Putin, Xi hot-mic moment revealed
content: A hot-mic moment captured Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping discussing biotechnology's potential to extend human life, possibly up to 150 years, with North Korean President Kim Jong Un observing. The exchange occurred during a military parade in Beijing, where Xi warned of a global crossroads between peace and war while showcasing China's military strength.

title: Amazon's cost-cutting rule: New phone policy; staff must report personal usage
content: Amazon is now requiring employees to meticulously report the percentage of work-related usage on their company phones. This is to adjust their $50 monthly reimbursements proportionally, based on personal use. This phone monitoring is part of broader cost-cutting measures under CEO Andy Jassy's "hardcore culture reset," leading to employee frustration and anxiety about job security.

title: Google’s ‘Preferred sources’ in Search: How to add Times of India
content: Google introduced a new feature called 'Preferred sources' on August 12, 2025, initially in India and the US (English). This allows users to select trusted news outlets, like Times of India, to see more of their coverage in Top stories and a 'From your sources' section.

title: No phones, laptops: Asset manager warns staff travelling to China; security risk cited
content: BlackRock has prohibited employees from using company-issued devices during China business trips, effective July 16, amid escalating geopolitical tensions. This decision follows Wells Fargo's suspension of China travel after a banker's detention, raising concerns across Wall Street. The restrictions reflect heightened security fears and operational challenges for global firms navigating US-China relations.

title: Hookah storm! Irfan Pathan breaks silence after Dhoni video controversy; comments on 'PR lobby'
content: After an old video of an Irfan Pathan interview resurfaced on social media and resulted in a massive speculation and debate on the way MS Dhoni managed the dressing room, Pathan himself has come forward to address the same. The former India all-rounder explained that his comments are being twisted and taken in a different context than intended, that too, half-a-decade after it came out.

title: GST relief: Footwear to get cheaper? Rate on apparels priced up to Rs 2,500 cut to 5%
content: The GST Council is expected to approve significant tax rate changes for footwear and apparel, potentially reducing the tax burden on consumers. Items priced up to Rs 2,500 may fall under the 5% GST slab. The council also intends to eliminate the 12% and 28% slabs, streamlining the tax structure and promoting economic transparency.

title: Youngest woman billionaire on leaving college; parents reaction; money lessons
content: Lucy Guo, the youngest self-made billionaire, attributes her success to her frugal upbringing and early entrepreneurial spirit. Despite disappointing her immigrant parents by dropping out of Carnegie Mellon, she pursued the Thiel Fellowship and founded successful ventures like Scale AI and Passes.

title: 'Double standards': Tejashwi digs up PM's remarks amid mother 'abuse' row
content: Tejashwi Yadav has strongly criticized PM Modi, accusing him of hypocrisy in the mother 'abuse' row, citing past controversial remarks. Yadav highlighted Modi's comments about Nitish Kumar's "DNA" and his campaigning for rape accused Prajwal Revanna.

title: Slapgate scandal: Ex-cricketer blasts Lalit Modi for reviving Harbhajan-Sreesanth episode
content: Robin Uthappa has criticized Lalit Modi and Michael Clarke. They released a video of the 2008 IPL 'Slapgate' incident. The video showed Harbhajan Singh slapping S Sreesanth. Uthappa questioned the insensitivity of releasing the video. He highlighted potential racial double standards in cricket. He suggested similar incidents involving non-Indian players are often handled differently. He emphasized the need for empathy.

title: GST meet: What will become cheaper after rate cuts? Top things to expect
content: The 56th GST Council meeting, presided over by Nirmala Sitharaman, is set to introduce significant changes to India's indirect taxation framework. The council is considering consolidating GST rates, potentially eliminating the 12% and 28% categories, and shifting items to 5% or 18% brackets.

title: Rain batters north India: Scores dead; roads flooded, schools shut
content: North India is facing severe hardship due to continuous rains. Rivers are overflowing, disrupting travel and forcing school closures. The India Meteorological Department issued red alerts for several regions. Punjab is experiencing its worst floods since 1988. Himachal Pradesh declared itself a disaster-affected state. Rescue operations are underway in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: Bronco or Yo-Yo: Fitness takes centre stage in Indian cricket, but is it sustainable?
content: The associations earlier followed a mark of 16.5 as cut-off for yo-yo but showed leniency by selecting even those who posted 14 as, unlike the Virat Kohli-Ravi Shastri era, there was no strict directive from the Indian cricket board. Compared to the world standards, India's Yo-Yo marker wasn't stiff but even then plenty of superstars found it difficult to pass the assessment between what became the dreaded cones in Indian cricket.

title: Talks in China: Kim Jong Un hugs Putin goodbye; vows to help with 'everything'
content: During bilateral talks in Beijing, Kim Jong Un pledged his full support to Vladimir Putin, expressing readiness to provide all possible assistance to Moscow. Putin praised North Korean soldiers' bravery, claiming they fought alongside Russian troops. Kim highlighted strengthened ties since last year's strategic partnership pact, considering support for Russia a "fraternal duty."

title: Raja Jackson under LAPD lens: Syko Stu links emerge; legal heat intensifies
content: Raja Jackson, son of MMA star Quinton “Rampage” Jackson, faces potential legal trouble after allegedly assaulting wrestler Syko Stu at a KnokX Pro Wrestling Academy event. The LAPD investigation is likely to be taken over by California state authorities. Syko Stu is now recovering from severe injuries, including head trauma and jaw fractures.

title: CBSE–NCB tie-up: 100 schools to pilot drug-free drive; 500+ teachers trained
content: CBSE and NCB have signed a Memorandum of Understanding to combat substance abuse in schools and promote a drug-free environment. The MoU outlines collaborative efforts such as awareness programmes, teacher training, counselling, and digital resources. A pilot programme will begin in 100 CBSE schools. Senior officials attended the event, followed by an awareness session for over 500 educators. This initiative aims to create a safe and supportive ecosystem for students across CBSE-affiliated schools in India.

title: FIDE Grand Swiss: Divya only Indian female in Open section; Gukesh in contention
content: The FIDE Grand Swiss 2025 in Samarkand will feature World Champion D Gukesh and Women’s World Cup winner Divya Deshmukh, alongside a strong Indian contingent. Gukesh aims to maintain momentum, while Deshmukh seeks to test herself against top players. With Candidates spots and significant prize money at stake, the tournament promises intense competition and a showcase of India's chess talent.

title: Gold prices cross Rs 1.07 lakh per 10 g in Delhi
content: Gold prices in Delhi reached a new record high, driven by expectations of a US Federal Reserve rate cut. Geopolitical tensions and concerns about the US economy also contributed to the surge. Silver traded flat, maintaining its record level. Globally, spot gold hit an all-time high, while spot silver saw a slight decrease.

title: 'Without US, world will die': Trump hails America as 'hottest, best'
content: Donald Trump asserted the US economy's strength under his leadership, attributing it to tariffs while criticizing India's trade practices, citing Harley-Davidson as an example. He claimed India imposes high tariffs while benefiting from minimal barriers in the US market. Trump also reiterated claims of settling wars, including averting potential nuclear conflict between India and Pakistan, amid strained US-India relations.

title: 'No such thing as visas for people from India': MAGA influencer schooled for racist post
content: Amidst trade tensions between the US and India and renewed calls to restrict H-1B visas, entrepreneur Karl Mehta criticized MAGA commentator Charlie Kirk's anti-Indian remarks. Kirk's statements about Indian workers displacing Americans and the US being "full" drew backlash. Mehta defended the contributions of Indian engineers and doctors to the US economy, expressing concerns over the safety of Indian-Americans.

title: Teachers Day 2025: 100+ best wishes, quotes and images for FB and WA
content: Teachers' Day in India honors Dr. Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan, celebrating teachers' vital role in shaping lives. Students express gratitude for their mentors' guidance and dedication. In 2025, individuals can use heartfelt wishes, messages, and quotes to appreciate teachers' profound impact on their academic and personal growth, acknowledging their invaluable contributions.

title: Punjab declared disaster-hit state: Over 1,200 villages submerged in worst floods
content: Punjab faces its worst floods in decades, declared a disaster-affected state, with over 1,200 villages impacted and lakhs of people affected. Authorities are implementing emergency measures, including restoring essential services and ensuring uninterrupted connectivity. Extensive farmland is submerged, causing devastating crop losses, and livestock has been lost, severely impacting rural households. Water levels in major dams are dangerously high.

title: Brittany Mahomes x Divi: Haircare collab unveiled; game-day glam set for 2025
content: Dallas haircare brand Divi collaborates with Brittany Mahomes. She is the wife of Kansas City Chiefs quarterback Patrick Mahomes. Brittany will be the central figure in Divi’s campaign. Divi focuses on scalp and hair health. They aim to leverage Brittany's presence. Divi will release a limited-edition Brittany Mahomes bundle. Fans can recreate her signature healthy hair look.

title: Israel building new nuke reactor? Experts raise alarm over satellite images
content: Satellite images reveal intensified construction at Israel's Dimona nuclear facility, sparking debate about its purpose and Israel's nuclear status. Experts suggest the new structure could be a reactor or a nuclear arms assembly site. Israel's nuclear program, established with French assistance in the 1950s, remains unacknowledged, and the nation has not joined the Nuclear Nonproliferation Treaty.

title: Boyfriend arrested for slitting 19-year-old’s throat in MP's Panchsheel Nagar
content: In Bhopal, TT Nagar police solved a murder case within 24 hours. The victim's boyfriend, Mubeen Khan, confessed to the crime. Police recovered the murder weapon based on his information. Mubeen killed his girlfriend because she refused to break off her engagement. He entered her house and slit her throat. The accused is now in jail.

title: 3 killed, 22 injured as SUV rams into Ganesh immersion procession in Chhattisgarh
content: A tragic incident in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur district claimed three lives and left 22 injured when a speeding SUV crashed into a Ganesh idol immersion procession late Tuesday night. The event unfolded in Jurudand village, Bagicha region, as a Bolero car veered into a crowd of devotees.

title: Meet Lucy Guo: World’s youngest self-made woman billionaire; know her achievements
content: Lucy Guo, at 30, has become the world's youngest self-made woman billionaire, surpassing Taylor Swift, thanks to her stake in Scale AI. She dropped out of Carnegie Mellon after the Thiel Fellowship to co-found the AI data-labeling company. Guo's entrepreneurial journey, from trading Pokémon cards to leading in AI and venture capital, showcases her disciplined work ethic and innovative spirit.

title: India ‘kills us with tariffs’: Trump throws another tantrum amid trade war
content: Donald Trump has accused India of being the 'most tariffed nation,' claiming a historically one-sided trade relationship favoring India. He stated India offered a 'no tariff' deal, but it's 'getting late.'

title: 'Colonial-era trope': Hindu group urges Trump to sack Navarro over Brahmin remark
content: Hindu advocacy group HinduPACT is asking for Peter Navarro's removal. The group condemns his remarks as inappropriate and Hinduphobic. They object to his reference to caste and portrayal of Narendra Modi in prayer. AHAD says Navarro's rhetoric endangers Hindus and threatens the relationship between India and US. They criticize his comments about Brahmins, calling it a colonial stereotype.

title: Hookah controversy! Irfan Pathan on MS Dhoni: 'Mere bina khana nahi khate the'
content: Irfan Pathan's relationship with MS Dhoni is under scrutiny again after an old interview resurfaced, suggesting Dhoni's alleged favouritism towards hookah-smoking players. This contrasts with Pathan's earlier statements about his close friendship with Dhoni, Suresh Raina, and Robin Uthappa. Despite his all-round abilities, Pathan's career ended abruptly, leading to speculation about Dhoni's influence on his exclusion.

title: Kim Jong Un’s 13-year old daughter makes international debut appearance
content: Kim Jong Un's daughter, believed to be Ju Ae, made her first public appearance abroad in Beijing, sparking speculation about her potential succession. South Korean intelligence suggests she is the leading candidate, despite doubts about a female ruler in the dynasty. Ju Ae has been increasingly visible at high-profile events, hinting at a growing role within the regime.

title: 'Right then, right now': Netanyahu shares old interview; likens Palestine recognition to fleeing a ‘grizzly bear’
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has criticised countries planning to recognise Palestine, comparing their actions to abandoning others to face a 'grizzly bear' of terrorism. He argues that no one can outrun terrorism and that the only solution is to confront and defeat it together.

title: Test cricket: 'Game reduced in quality'; ex-England captains call for big reforms
content: Alastair Cook and Michael Vaughan have called for significant reforms to Test cricket rules. Cook suggested allowing teams to take two new balls within 160 overs at their discretion, while Vaughan advocated for broader substitution rules beyond concussion replacements to maintain match quality. Both believe these changes are crucial for Test cricket's competitiveness and player welfare.

title: Delhi flood alert: In 63 years, Yamuna breached 207m only in four rainy seasons
content: The Yamuna River in Delhi has surged past the danger mark, displacing over 10,000 people across 28 locations. Water levels are expected to rise further, potentially breaching a 63-year high. Increased water discharge from Haryana's Hathnikund barrage is exacerbating the situation, leading to traffic diversions and concerns about prolonged flooding in low-lying areas.

title: Hyderabad techie dies after rusted streetlight pole falls on him
content: In a tragic incident in Hyderabad, B Satvik, a 23-year-old software professional, died when a rusted streetlight pole collapsed on him while he was riding his bike at Nacharam crossroads. Satvik was returning home when the weakened pole gave way, pinning him underneath. Police confirmed the pole's deterioration due to rust as the cause of the fatal accident.

title: 'Age just a number': 39-yr Sikandar Raza; 35-yr Keshav Maharaj take top ICC spots
content: Sikandar Raza, at 39, has achieved the number one all-rounder ranking in ICC Men’s ODI, driven by consistent performances with both bat and ball during the series against Sri Lanka. Despite Zimbabwe's series loss, Raza's individual brilliance stood out, highlighted by back-to-back half-centuries and impactful bowling.

title: Ileana on comeback: 'Balancing motherhood & films'; 'aware of fickle world'
content: Ileana D’cruz, residing in Houston with her husband Michael Dolan, expressed her longing to return to acting after becoming a mother of two. While she misses being on screen and working with talented individuals, she prioritizes being a hands-on mom to her sons.

title: Is Trump being ironic? Russia rejects 'conspiracy against US' charge on Putin, Xi, Kim
content: Russia refuted Donald Trump's claim that Vladimir Putin, Kim Jong Un, and Xi Jinping were conspiring against the US during a Beijing military parade. The Kremlin dismissed Trump's accusation as potentially ironic, emphasizing that no such conspiracy existed among the leaders. Xi Jinping's address highlighted a global choice between peace and war during the parade.

title: 14 teams that will make the NFL playoffs -- and six that will be left out: Barnwell’s preseason picks
content: Which teams from last season's playoffs will return? Who will be the surprises in the 14-team bracket? And who will win the Super Bowl?

title: Bold predictions, strengths and concerns for all 32 teams
content: Here's everything you need to know ahead of the NFL regular season, including how teams rank before Week 1.

title: Valdez apologizes after crossing up Astros catcher
content: Astros starter Framber Valdez said he apologized to catcher Cesar Salazar after hitting him in the chest with a pitch Tuesday night, but the left-hander insisted it wasn't intentional.

title: Djokovic spars with US Open crowd, ousts Fritz
content: Novak Djokovic engaged in some back-and-forth with those in the crowd pulling for the last American man in the field as he advanced to a record-extending 53rd Grand Slam semifinal.

title: Hold that, Tiger: Kelly asks if Dabo saw 2nd half
content: After Dabo Swinney gave his grades for Saturday's game -- "they made a 65; we made a 58" -- LSU's Brian Kelly questioned if the Clemson coach saw the second half.

title: 3 tossed from Giants-Rockies after Devers homer
content: The Rockies' Kyle Freeland along with the Giants' Matt Chapman and Willy Adames were ejected following a benches-clearing incident that started after Rafael Devers hit a two-run home run.

title: Ohtani belts 100th HR with Dodgers in record time
content: Shohei Ohtani hit his 100th home run with the Dodgers in his 294th game with the team, the fastest in franchise history.

title: Sanders bites back over Buffs' clock management
content: A feisty Deion Sanders is pushing back against anyone second-guessing his clock management or calling out his coaching staff.

title: McLean retires last 14, 1st Met to win 1st 4 starts
content: Nolan McLean became the first Mets pitcher to win his first four career starts, retiring the final 14 batters he faced in a 12-5 win over the Tigers on Tuesday.

title: 📝 Schefter's cheat sheet: Picks, sleepers to target
content: No one is more plugged in to the latest buzz around the NFL than Adam Schefter. We asked him to share his favorite values in fantasy drafts with you.

title: MLB trade deadline winners and losers -- a month later
content: A look at where all 30 teams stand ahead of the final stretch -- and if their deadline deals have actually paid off.

title: 'I'm going to be that person:' Eagles A.J. Brown wants more for himself, and for others
content: All indications point to Brown being "hungrier than ever," as the Eagles begin to defend their title.

title: Can you import an entire offense? OU hopes so with John Mateer, Ben Arbuckle
content: OU is the latest team to bring in a new playcaller and QB to boost offense. The Sooners need big things from Mateer and Arbuckle.

title: AP Week 1 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: College football came back in a big way this past weekend, with high-profile matchups and some surprise scores. Now it's time to look forward for the country's best teams.

title: How the relationship between Micah Parsons and the Cowboys broke down
content: Micah Parsons wanted to be a Dallas Cowboy "for life." The disputed nature of a March meeting with Jerry Jones helped chart a course for his exit.

title: Matchup rankings: Chase Brown, Emeka Egbuka stand out in Week 1
content: Matchups are the key to fantasy lineup decisions. Here are the most and least favorable for Week 1 at QB, RB, WR and TE.

title: USMNT transfer grades: Analyzing every American move in the summer window
content: A bunch of USMNT players have been on the move. Let's grade them all, from Matt Turner to Gio Reyna and everyone in between ahead of the 2026 World Cup.

title: LeBron, Kobe and the scars that led to Redeem Team gold in 2008
content: Following a disappointing bronze medal in the 2004 Olympics, the 2008 Team USA roster was out for redemption.

title: From walk-offs to blowouts to ... did that really just happen?! All of the ways the Rockies have lost games in 2025
content: Colorado has lost games in practically every way imaginable this season. We look back on how the team reached 100 losses.

title: 'Just getting started:' Why Lamar Jackson believes he can take his game to another level
content: Jackson is only a few months removed from one of the best seasons by a quarterback in NFL history, and he still expects to get better.

title: Latest rosters for 90+ men's college basketball teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're updating key rosters as players arrive on campus for the 2025-26 season.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Best-case scenarios for all 13 teams to end the season
content: From home-court advantage in the first round to awards, here's what each team is playing for down the stretch.

title: Five months from Olympics, here's what you should know about Team USA men's hockey
content: Will Matthew Tkachuk be healthy enough to play? Can Tage Thompson crack the lineup? We look at some of the biggest topics coming out of the recent orientation camp.

title: Buffalo Bills WR Khalil Shakir helps save 19 dogs from being euthanized
content: The Bills wide receiver helped local rescue, Nickel City Canine Rescue, with a transfer of dogs from Clarke County Animal Shelter.

title: Worst transfers of the window, ranked: From Cunha to Isak, 13 big moves that might fail
content: This summer transfer window had its share of good moves, but we're ranking the 13 worst ones. Did Man United, Liverpool and Arsenal mess up?

title: How did Liverpool afford their $600 million summer of spending?
content: Liverpool won the Premier League title last season but went on a spending spree. Why? And how did they do it?

title: WSL preview: Chelsea, City, Arsenal to fight for title? Liverpool, Spurs in danger?
content: Chelsea have won the last six WSL titles, but will they focus on UWCL glory? How will promoted London City do? And could Liverpool, Spurs drop down?

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United already working on Baleba deal
content: Manchester United are already working on a deal for Brighton & Hove Albion midfielder Carlos Baleba. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Weekly pickups: Jonah Tong, Payton Tolle lead fantasy playoff picks
content: The players you should claim off the waiver wire, including some pitchers to help you in the fantasy playoffs.

title: Yamuna Floodwater Enters Nigambodh Ghat In Delhi, Cremations Halted
content: Cremations at Nigambodh Ghat, Delhi's largest cremation ground, have been suspended after Yamuna floodwater entered the premises, officials said on Wednesday.

title: 3 Killed, 22 Injured As SUV Crashes Into Religious Procession In Chhattisgarh: Cops
content: 3 persons were killed and 22 others suffered injuries when an SUV, driven by an inebriated man, ploughed into a religious procession in Chhattisgarh's Jashpur district, police said on Wednesday.

title: Google Chrome Escapes Forced Sell-Off As Court Cites Rise Of ChatGPT In Antitrust Ruling
content: Google has avoided the most severe penalty in its antitrust case. A US court ruled the tech giant won't be forced to sell Chrome, its globally dominant web browser.

title: Pics: Fresh Rains Brew Trouble In Punjab; Schools Shut Till September 7
content: A fresh spell of heavy rains compounded the flood situation in Punjab, which is battling its worst deluge since 1988, as all 23 districts of the state have been hit and 30 lives lost so far.

title: "Stop Singling Out India...": US Expert On Trump's Russia Oil Charges
content: US Strategic Affairs Expert Ashley J. Tellis said that the US should stop "singling out" India over President Donald Trump's frustration regarding the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict.

title: Snakebite Risk Rising In Indian Regions Due To Climate Change: Study
content: Climate change could be creating conditions conducive for venomous snakes to shift and spread into India's north and northeast, potentially increasing risks of snakebites in regions so far considered unsuitable for the species, a study has found.

title: "Not Like BJP...": Tejashwi Yadav On PM Hitting Out At Opposition Over Abuse
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav has condemned the use of derogatory words on Prime Minister Narendra Modi's late mother during a joint RJD-Congress rally in Bihar.

title: Gangster Arun Gawli Leaves Nagpur Jail After 17 Years After Bail In Murder Case
content: After spending more than 17 years behind bars, gangster-turned-politician Arun Gawli on Wednesday walked out of the Nagpur Central Jail days with the Supreme Court granting him bail in a 2007 murder case, officials said.

title: MK Stalin Takes A Dig At PM Modi Over Russian Oil, BJP Says "Immature"
content: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin took a swipe at Prime Minister Narendra Modi, questioning the Centre's logic of procuring discounted Russian crude oil for Gujarat refineries while exporters in Tamil Nadu's Tiruppur reel under steep US tariffs.

title: Only 3 People Granted Citizenship Under CAA in Assam: Himanta Sarma
content: On a day the MHA announced an extension of the cut-off date for entry into India for applying under the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said only 3 foreigners have been granted citizenship in the state under the Act so far.

title: Pics: Delhi Streets Turn Into Streams, Markets Under Water Amid Yamuna Flooding
content: Streets turned into streams and marketplaces into pools of murky water as residents of low-lying Delhi areas rushed to save their lives and belongings as the Yamuna continued to swell.

title: Over 1 Billion People Were Affected By Mental Health Conditions In 2021: WHO
content: More than a billion people around the world -- around one in every seven -- were living with mental health conditions in 2021, with anxiety and depressive disorders accounting for over two-thirds of all cases, the World Health Organisation (WHO) said

title: Opinion: Opinion | No, This Is Not About Ganging Up Against The US
content: At Tianjin, what was evident with India was an ambidextrous policy of engaging with friend and foe alike, using the one to balance out the other. That's all very well. But it just scratches the surface.

title: "Why Can't You Sort It Out?" Court To Mahua Moitra, Lawyer Over Dog Custody
content: The Delhi High Court on Wednesday asked why Trinamool Congress MP Mahua Moitra and advocate Jai Anant Dehadrai cannot "sit together" and resolve their battle over the custody of a pet dog.

title: Russia To Supply More "Game-Changer" S-400s, Which Pak Failed To Penetrate
content: Russia is expected to start delivering more S-400 units, months after the air defence system emerged as an impenetrable shield for India during its war debut against Pakistan.

title: "Punjab Is Strong": Harbhajan Singh's Message Of Resilience From Flood-Hit Punjab
content: Punjab is strong and will overcome this tough situation, said former cricketer and AAP's Rajya Sabha MP Harbhajan Singh in a message of resilience, as he appealed through NDTV to help the Punjabis struggling against a dire flood situation.

title: "Spirit Of Punjab": Elderly Man Seen Serving Tea To Relief Workers Amid Flood
content: Rajya Sabha member Harbhajan Singh has shared an account from flood-hit Punjab showing an elderly villager offering tea to relief workers.

title: Heavy Rains Lash Parts Of Delhi, Yamuna Continues To Flow Above Danger Mark
content: Heavy rains lashed parts of Delhi-NCR on Wednesday afternoon. According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the forecast for Delhi is "generally cloudy sky with moderate rain" today.

title: Man Acquitted In Rape Case After 51 Days As Woman Claims "Misunderstanding"
content: A man was acquitted in a rape case by a court in Kolkata after the complainant woman claimed she had lodged the complaint "due to some misunderstanding".

title: Gold Prices In India To Surge To Rs 125,000 By 2026: Report
content: Indian gold prices are expected to continue rising, trading in the range of Rs 99,500 to Rs 110,000 per ten grams over the rest of 2025, and moving higher to Rs 110,000 to Rs 125,000 in the first half of 2026, according to a research

title: Survivor pool strategy: The top teams to take in NFL's Week 1
content: ESPN Eliminator Challenge is one of the easiest and most fun games to play this season . pick one team, and as long as they win (or tie), you advance to the next round . if they lose, you are out . the biggest favorites tend to win the most over the long run .

title: Canelo, Crawford, Mayweather: Top 25 boxers of the century
content: two of the best fighters of this generation meet on sept. 13 at Allegiant Stadium in Las Vegas . undisputed super middleweight champion canelo Alvarez meets junior middleweight champ Terence Crawford . a list of 25 retired fighters to step into the ring has been put together by ESPN .

title: Way-Too-Early Top 25 rankings: Every team's top awards candidate
content: college basketball is just around the corner . it was another quiet month for college hoops . the top 25 from the July and August editions remains the same . we're focusing on one candidate from each Top 25 team .

title: Why Dwight Howard absolutely belongs as a first-ballot Hall of Famer
content: dwight Howard will be enshrined in the Naismith Memorial Basketball Hall of Fame this weekend . as of 2021, Howard was one of 26 players in NBA history with at least five first-team All-NBA nods . the other 25 were named to the league's 75th Anniversary Team that year .

title: College football betting lines: Michigan heads to Oklahoma in ranked showdown
content: the Seminoles rose the highest in this week's AP Poll . Florida State beat Alabama as 13.5-point underdogs fall to no. 21 . only four conferences are represented in the poll, according to ESPN Research .

title: Angel Reese appears in feature film 'A House of Dynamite' alongside Idris Elba
content: angel Reese made her big screen debut at the Venice Film Festival on tuesday . the WNBA forward also made her debut in "A House of Dynamite" the movie stars Idris Elba, Rebecca Ferguson and Anthony Ramos . resuding the president on a basketball court before shooting hoops with his character .

title: Fantasy baseball news: Tucker to sit for Cubs; Boston's Anthony leaves early
content: the fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around baseball . the los Angeles Angels will reportedly call up Caden Dana to handle tonight's road start against the Kansas City Royals .

title: Total lunar eclipse on the intervening night of Sept. 7 and 8
content: Jawaharlal Nehru Planetarium is organising demonstration lectures about the eclipse late in the evening of September 7

title: CM promises basic facilities for pilgrims visiting Anjanadri Hill in Koppal
content: Siddaramaiah says that only ₹10 crore has been released so far, though ₹200 crore was earmarked for the purpose

title: Corporatised ordnance factories post record ₹3,500-crore export orders in 2024-25
content: Since October 2021, when 41 Ordnance Factory Board units were reorganised into seven entities, six of the companies have posted profits

title: Trader booked for selling fertilisers at higher price in Kurnool district
content: Police inspect Sri Lakshmi fertiliser shop in Jain Doddi and verify stocks and bill books, which throw light that the owner has been selling fertilisers at more than the MRP

title: Ahead of Onam, demand for air tickets from West Asia to Kerala dips
content: The unusual trend is attributed to the festival season not coinciding with the school vacation in the Gulf. This time, schools reopen after Onam and hence the return air fare to the West Asia has shot up

title: INS Trikand reaches Egypt to join multilateral drill Bright Star 2025
content: During her port call at Alexandria, the Indian naval stealth frigate will engage in professional and cultural exchanges, including meetings with senior military officials, cross-deck visits, sports events, and cultural activities aimed at deepening bilateral and multilateral ties

title: Three killed, 22 injured as vehicle hits visarjan procession in Chhattisgarh
content: The incident, caused allegedly by an inebriated driver of an SUV, was reported in Jurudand village in Jashpur district on Tuesday night

title: Tamil Nadu government must pay compensation to conned senior citizens if police fail to recover lost valuables: Madras High Court
content: Justice D. Bharatha Chakravarthy says, he has only suggested a bare minimum amount and that Tamil Nadu government could fix a higher compensation

title: Two students keep English medium government school running in Kanniyakumari district
content: Class IV student gained a schoolmate on September 2, when another child enrolled in Class I, raising the total strength of the school to two.

title: Learn new skills to become leaders of change, President Murmu tells graduands
content: The President calls upon the younger generation to keep learning to ensure that their skills are always in demand.

title: Kerala doctors save boy from rare dual brain infections
content: Medical team at Government Medical College Hospital, Thiruvananthapuram, has successfully treated and saved a 17-year-old boy, who was suffering from a rare co-infection of amoebic meningoencephalitis and Aspergillus flavus fungal infection, both of which are individually life-threatening infections

title: Tirupati civic chief expresses displeasure over public indifference on garbage disposal
content: Though we send our vehicles to every locality to pick up garbage, there are some who fail to utilise the services and dump it at street corners, and this will not be tolerated, says Narapureddy Mourya

title: Onam Pookkalam with a spread of anti-war message
content: Picasso’s iconic protest painting reimagined in flowers, reminding that peace is the true harvest of prosperity

title: Hindu outfits to organise meet to counter Ayyappa summit
content: Sabarimala Karma Samiti and other Hindu organisations are set to organise ‘Sabarimala Samrakshana Sangamam’ at Pandalam on September 22

title: Man arrested for alleged single-digit lottery trade
content: A mobile phone that he reportedly used to operate the business, liquid cash to the tune of ₹5,450, and a few paper lots carrying single digit recovered

title: RIR Power to commence commercial production of semiconductor chip next March, says Odisha’s Principal Secretary for IT
content: RIR Power was accorded fiscal support of ₹32.56 crore for Phase 1 of their two-phase project for silicon carbide manufacturing plant in the Bhubaneswar

title: GST reforms are in the best interests of the poor, says Andhra Pradesh Finance Minister Payyavula Keshav
content: The reforms will help in expanding the Indian economy and rationalise the tax rates on items of common consumption, he says

title: Cabinet likely to discuss UKP-III phase today
content: It will discuss the compensation, land acquisition, rehabilitation, and reconstruction issues, says D.K. Shivakumar

title: Karnataka High Court issues notice to ED on plea filed by MLA Veerendra’s wife challenging his arrest
content: It was contended that the grounds of arrest mentioned in the arrest memo were vague, generic, and formulaic, contrary to the requirements of law as laid down by the apex court

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Global Responsible Tourism delegation to tour Kerala during Onam
content: The delegation, comprising RT experts, academicians, and tour operators, will visit various destinations in the State from September 4 to 1.  The team will have first-hand experience of  Onam celebrations and the State’s RT model

title: Amaravati is a safe and fast-developing capital city, says Andhra Pradesh Minister for Urban Development Narayana
content: Dismissing the ‘malicious propaganda’ that the city’s development exists only in graphics, the Minister asserts that work on the housing blocks is progressing at a rapid pace

title: Vishwakarma community members urged not to mention any sub-caste during census
content: The community’s population needs to be properly enumerated for us to get govt. benefits, says president of Vishwakarma Mahasabha

title: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike to Greater Bengaluru Authority: All you need to know
content: Read The Hindu’s complete coverage of how Bengaluru is entering a new era as it transitions from one governing corporation to a three-level model

title: Health Ministry to amend 2019 rules for new drugs, clinical trials
content: Requirements for test licenses, and applications for studies on bioavailability, bioequivalence to be streamlined; regulatory reforms expected to benefit stakeholders by significantly reducing timelines for processing applications

title: Persecuted Hindus, Sikhs, Jains from Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Pakistan who entered India up to 2024 to be allowed to stay: MHA
content: The order will come as a relief to a large number of people, especially Hindus from Pakistan, who crossed over to India after 2014 and were worried about their fate

title: Video of municipal staff falling at DMK councillor’s feet in Tindivanam sparks criticism
content: The video shows Muniyappan, a junior assistant from a Scheduled Caste community, falling at the feet of Ramya Raja, Councillor of Ward 20, apologising for certain remarks he had made against her; Ms. Raja, however, complained he touched her inappropriately

title: Kerala govt. sets up panel to recommend measures to prevent accidents caused by cables drawn on electricity poles
content: In 2024, the State Human Rights Commission had asked the Electricity department to furnish guidelines related to the use of electricity posts for drawing cable TV and internet service provider cables

title: Allahabad High Court reserves verdict on Rahul Gandhi's plea
content: The magisterial court had earlier rejected the plea on November 28 last year, stating that the speech was made in the U.S. and therefore the issue fell beyond its jurisdiction

title: Satheesan sets ‘conditions’ for extending support to Global Ayyappa Sanghamam
content: Leader of the Opposition in the Kerala Assembly demands that the LDF government withdraw cases registered against Ayyappa devotees during the Save Sabarimala campaign in 2018, when they resisted the govt. bid to facilitate entry of women of all ages into Sabarimala. Satheesan also wants the LDF disavow the Navodhana Samrakshana Samithi

title: Assam’s Bodoland becomes first tribal council to digitise land records
content: Over 15 lakh land documents, including maps, digitised across 8,970 sq. km Bodoland Territorial Region

title: Kerala to organise conclave to finalise urban policy for 25 years
content: Two-day conclave in Kochi, from September 12, will become a platform for public discussions on the recommendations of the Urban Policy Commission that were submitted to the Chief Minister earlier this year. Ideas at the conclave will be considered for formulating the policy

title: In Focus Podcast | Can India’s real money gaming ban withstand constitutional scrutiny?
content: Last month, the Lok Sabha passed the Promotion and Regulation of Online Gaming Bill, 2025. In this episode, Deepak Joshi unpacks the legislation – its sweeping ban on real-money gaming, the constitutional implications of such a move, and whether bypassing stakeholder consultation undermines the government’s attempt to tackle these concerns effectively

title: Hope EU-India FTA will be concluded soon: Jaishankar after meeting German counterpart
content: The External Affairs Minister said the talks focused on boosting bilateral ties in areas of economy, climate change, defence, technology

title: Tiruvallur district administration ropes in infra firms to desilt channels; 150 km of waterways to be cleared ahead of monsoon
content: The district administration is utilising the services of large construction firms that are involved in the laying of roads in Tiruvallur. L&T, Tata, and SPK have donated their equipment, including earthmovers, and operators, he added.

title: Bombay High Court asks Manoj Jarange to clarify his role in damages during Maratha quota stir
content: The High Court directs Maratha reservation protest organisers to respond to public property damage allegations within four weeks and also criticises the Maharashtra government’s handling of the agitation

title: Knives are out in BRS, I have no part in family politics: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy reacts to Kavitha’s allegations
content: Tearing into the opposition party, the Telangana CM says amid his focus on development of State he doesn’t have time for such family politics

title: Congress leader Pawan Khera's wife also has two active voter ID cards, alleges BJP
content: This comes a day after the ruling BJP alleged that Mr. Khera had two voter IDs and Mr. Gandhi was running a campaign against voter-roll revision in Bihar to "protect and hide" his party's theft of votes.

title: Delhi HC denies bail to man impersonating as Amit Shah’s nephew, cheating businessman
content: The man allegedly assured the complainant that get a ₹90 crore tender from the central government for the supply of leather for renovating the President’s estate

title: PMK’s Disciplinary Action Committee to send second show-cause notice to Anbumani Ramadoss
content: Speaking to reporters at his Thailapuram residence on Wednesday, PMK founder S. Ramadoss said the Administrative Committee had unanimously decided to grant time till September 10 to Mr. Anbumani to respond to the notice

title: Satheesan non-committal on Rahul Mamkootathil’s attendance in Assembly
content: Opposition leader says UDF will take “appropriate decision at the appropriate time” ahead of September 15 session

title: Elgar Parishad case: Supreme Court defers Surendra Gadling bail plea to September 17
content: A Bench comprising Justices J.K. Maheshwari and K. Vinod Chandran deferred the matter after Additional Solicitor General S.V. Raju sought time

title: Two more cases booked against Girish Mattannavar in Belthangady
content: Mr. Mattannavar and fellow activist Mahesh Shetty Thimarody have already been booked by Belthangady police for assault of Suvarna news channel reporter and also for unlawful assembly in front of a private hospital in Ujire on August 6

title: Mizoram residents hope the new Bairabi-Sairang line brings seamless changes into their life
content: Travel time between Silchar and Aizawl to be cut from 8-10 hours by road to under four hours by train

title: India to test battery storage at coal plants to balance grid as solar power surges
content: CEA chairman Ghanshyam Prasad said that coal power generator NTPC had been tasked with testing this at some plants and given funding support

title: Maratha protest: Quota petitioner calls Government Resolution ‘completely useless’
content: The truth is, not a single certificate will come out of this GR. I have fought a legal battle for the community, and I can say with certainty that those without documentary proof of Kunbi lineage will never gain anything, says Activist Vinod Patil

title: India’s first vulture conservation portal launched in Assam
content: An Assam-based foundation developed the portal to compile scientific information, spread awareness, and provide free downloadable outreach materials

title: Supreme Court raps Sukesh Chandrasekhar’s wife plea seeking expeditious hearing in Delhi High Court
content: A Bench of Justices Dipankar Datta and Prashant Kumar Mishra said the tendency of approaching the apex court for seeking an early hearing of cases is not acceptable

title: 3 foreigners got Indian citizenship in Assam under CAA: Himanta
content: We have received only 12 applications so far. The remaining nine applications are under consideration, says Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma

title: 100 years of the Self-Respect Movement in Tamil Nadu
content: Social reformer ‘Periyar’ E.V. Ramasamy, through the launch of Tamil weekly Kudi Arasu (Republic), paved way for the formal beginning of the Self-Respect Movement

title: Gurugram STF arrests Haryana's most wanted gangster Mainpal Badli
content: Mainpal was detained in Cambodia about 10 days ago and was caught by a joint team of central agencies and Gurugram STF under a secret operation.

title: How can friendship be proved through documentary evidence, asks Madras High Court in case on kidney transplant
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh sets aside an authorisation committee’s order denying permission for renal transplantation because the donor and recipient could not produce proof of being family friends

title: IMD issues red alert in J&K, Punjab, Himachal Pradesh and other states
content: The India Meteorological Department issues red alert warnings for multiple Indian states due to heavy rainfall, posing risks of floods and landslides

title: Modi govt won't rest till all Naxals surrender, caught or eliminated: Amit Shah
content: Mr. Shah said the bravery and valour displayed by the jawans during Operation Black Forest will be remembered as a “golden chapter in the history of anti-Naxal operations”

title: Happiest moment turned into something tragic: Kohli reflects on Bengaluru stampede
content: The tragic incident occurred when an estimated 2.5 lakh fans thronged at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium to celebrate RCB's maiden IPL title

title: Updated SP+ rankings for all 136 FBS teams
content: in a single sentence, it's a tempo- and opponent-adjusted measure of college football efficiency . it does not automatically give credit for big wins or particularly brave scheduling . early in the season, ratings are based primarily on preseason projections .

title: Life on the WNBA fringe: Suitcases, sacrifice, soul-searching
content: haley Jones reserved a drawer for her gear for her Atlanta Dream gear . she cleared out two more drawers for two more teams . there's 3:42 to go in the game, and Dallas is down 76-74 with six seconds on the shot clock .

title: 'He's not trying to be a celebrity': How Justin Fields differs from Aaron Rodgers
content: a week 1 win means more for Justin Fields than for Aaron Rodgers, who is still building his career . he summoned the quarterback to new jersey and fired him in a meeting that turned contentious . "i respected it," one player said, reflecting on how he felt at the time .

title: Sources: Jets' Vera-Tucker has significant injury
content: New York Jets  starting guard  Alijah Vera-Tucker  has a significant arm injury, sources told ESPN's Adam Schefter. Vera-Tucker is receiving a second medical opinion on the injury but could ultimately need surgery, sources told Schefter, jeopardizing his ability to play this season. Vera-Tucker, 26, was a first-round draft selection in 2021 and is entering the final year of his contract. The Jets are counting on the 308-pound Vera-Tucker, who recently was voted as a team captain, to help anchor their offensive line and pave the way for their run-oriented attack this season.

title: Bottom 10: Tide got rolled -- but Bama isn't the only Power 4 stinker
content: Rich Eisen shares his thoughts with Stephen A. Smith on bill Belichick's coaching debut with UNC . "merrimack county," Tom Rush Here at Bottom 10 Headquarters, located beside a roulette table in Tahoe . the Warriors went and upset the bottom 10 cosmic balance during college football's opening weekend, like Thanos snapping his fingers .

title: Avoiding the sophomore slump: Three things to watch for as Bo Nix enters Year 2
content: the Broncos' 2024 season ended with a thud thanks to a 31-7 playoff loss to the Buffalo Bills in the wild-card round in January . but he decided that it was too early for a season to end . he is days away from his second regular-season opener against the Tennessee Titans at Empower Field .

title: Ready for Week 1, the Browns are stocked with young talent, a reshaped QB room and an energized Myles Garrett
content: shedeur Sanders' final preseason performance could doom his chances of playing in the regular season . he says he'd never wear an all-brown suit again . the decor was a nod to Garrett's love for the prehistoric animals .
